com.finch4alice

Class Melody

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.finch4alice.Melody

  • public class Melody
extends Object
    A collection of musical notes, intended to be played in sequence.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Melody(String name, int beatsPerMinute, List<Note> notes)
      Constructs a new Melody instance with the specified name, beats per minute and array of notes.
      Melody(String name, int beatsPerMinute, Note[] notes)
      Constructs a new Melody instance with the specified name, beats per minute and array of notes.

      Retrieves the number of beats per minute.

      Retrieves the number of milliseconds a whole note will play, based on the specified number of beats per minute.

      Determine the most common duration used by the Notes in the Melody.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Melody

        public Melody(String name,
              int beatsPerMinute,
              Note[] notes)
        Constructs a new Melody instance with the specified name, beats per minute and array of notes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Melody.
        beatsPerMinute - Number of beats per minute to assign to the Melody.
        notes - Array of Note instances that make up the Melody.

      • Melody

        public Melody(String name,
              int beatsPerMinute,
              List<Note> notes)
        Constructs a new Melody instance with the specified name, beats per minute and array of notes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Melody.
        beatsPerMinute - Number of beats per minute to assign to the Melody.
        notes - List of Note instances that make up the Melody.

    • Method Detail

      • getNotes

        public List<Note> getNotes()
        Retrieves a List of the Notes for this Melody.
        Returns:
        A List of the Notes for this Melody. This list is live, so any modifications to the list or the Notes contained in it will affect the Melody itself.

      • setNotes

        public void setNotes(Note[] notes)
        Sets the Notes for the Melody.
        Parameters:
        notes - Array of Note instances that make up the Melody. The array itself is copied, however the Notes themselves are added by reference. Can be null, in which case all Notes are removed from the Melody.

      • setNotes

        public void setNotes(List<Note> notes)
        Sets the Notes for the Melody.
        Parameters:
        notes - List of Note instances that make up the Melody. The List itself is copied, however the Notes themselves are added by reference. Can be null, in which case all Notes are removed from the Melody.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Retrieves the name of the Melody.
        Returns:
        The name of the Melody.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Sets the name of the Melody.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for the Melody. If null or empty string, a name of "Unnamed" will be assigned. The name cannot contain a colon (:) character.

      • getBeatsPerMinute

        public int getBeatsPerMinute()
        Retrieves the number of beats per minute.
        Returns:
        The number of beats per minute.

      • setBeatsPerMinute

        public void setBeatsPerMinute(int beatsPerMinute)
        Sets the number of beats per minute for the Melody.
        Parameters:
        beatsPerMinute - The number of beats per minute for the Melody.

      • getMillisecondsPerWholeNote

        public double getMillisecondsPerWholeNote()
        Retrieves the number of milliseconds a whole note will play, based on the specified number of beats per minute.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds a whole note will play.

      • parseRTTTL

        public static Melody parseRTTTL(String rtttl)
        Constructs and populates a new Melody object by parsing an RTTTL (Ring Tone Text Transfer Language) string.
        Parameters:
        rtttl - The RTTTL-encoded string to parse.
        Returns:
        Returns a new Melody instance initialized from the specified RTTTL string.
        See Also:
        Wikipedia entry on RTTTL, Mobilefish RTTTL Tutorial

      • getMostCommonOctave

        public int getMostCommonOctave()
        Determine the most common octave used by the Notes in the Melody.
        Returns:
        The most common octave used by the Notes in the Melody.

      • getMostCommonDuration

        public int getMostCommonDuration()
        Determine the most common duration used by the Notes in the Melody.
        Returns:
        The most common duration used by the Notes in the Melody.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Generates an RTTTL formatted string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        An RTTTL formatted string, using the most common duration and octave values.

      • toString

        public String toString(int defaultDuration,
                       int defaultOctave)
        Generates an RTTTL formatted string using the specified default duration and octave values.
        Parameters:
        defaultDuration - The default duration value to use. This duration will be output in the 'd=' settings field, and any notes matching the specified duration will not have a duration output in the generated string. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, and 32.
        defaultOctave - The default octave value to use. This octave
        Returns:
        An RTTTL formatted string using the specified default duration and octave values.
